title: Prab Punyapat Maprapho, MD
text: I’m Educator at heart and Data Scientist in Learning analytics as one of his favorite hobbies. When not innovating on data platforms, Prab enjoys spending time taking care of patients as another side husle as primary care physician.

title: Authentic Assessment - Foundation and application
text:
Consensus of Good Assessment
Where the authentic assessment shine in the Ottawa consensus of good assessment?


1.Validity
2.Reliability
3.Equivalence

4.Feasibility


5.Educational effect
6.Catalytic effect
7.Acceptability

Norcini et al. (2018)

Authenticity vs Fidelity
Higher Fidelity introduces Higher cognitive load








Low Cognitive Load



Authenticity? - Documentation


Authenticity? - OSCE

OSCE conversation






Patient - คุณสมชาย แข็งแรง
Doctor - นศพ.ปุญญภัทร





สวัสดีครับ คุณสมชาย ผม นศพ.ปุญญภัทร ปี 6


สวัสดีครับหมอ ผมหายใจเหนื่อยมา 2-3 วันแล้วครับ
อาการเหนื่อยเป็นยังไงหรอครับ


เวลาผมเดิน 30-40 นาที มันก็จะเริ่มเหนื่อย
มีโรคประจำตัวอะไรบ้างครับ


โรคประจำตัว เช่น โรคอะไรบ้างหรอหมอ





Harden and Norman (2016)


Authenticity? - WPBA
Does authentic assessment undermine authentic learning?






It undermines


Only if students perceive assessment as high-stake and judgmental



. . .
AA works, when

Students could show undercentainty and vulnaribility
Using WPA is authentic and acknowledge complexity of case


Hatala and Ellaway (2024)


Authenticity? - Projects

Check Reliability


Norcini et al. (2018)


References


Harden, Ronald M., and Geoffrey R. Norman, eds. 2016. The Definitive Guide to the OSCE: The Objective Structured Clinical Examination as a Performance Assessment. Edinburgh: Elsevier.


Hatala, Rose, and Rachel H. Ellaway. 2024. “Does Authentic Assessment Undermine Authentic Learning?” Advances in Health Sciences Education 29 (4): 1067–70. https://doi.org/10.1007/s10459-024-10361-z.


Norcini, John, M. Brownell Anderson, Valdes Bollela, Vanessa Burch, Manuel João Costa, Robbert Duvivier, Richard Hays, Maria Felisa Palacios Mackay, Trudie Roberts, and David Swanson. 2018. “2018 Consensus Framework for Good Assessment.” Medical Teacher 40 (11): 1102–9. https://doi.org/10.1080/0142159X.2018.1500016.

title: Authentic Assessment - Foundation and application
text:
Authenticity? - WPBA
Does authentic assessment undermine authentic learning?







It undermines


Only if students perceive assessment as high-stake and judgmental









AA works, when



Students could show undercentainty and vulnaribility as shown in Figure 1
Using WPA is authentic and acknowledge complexity of case






Hatala & Ellaway (2024),

title: Summary of Foundation of Assessment
text:
Quiz
What is the main conclusion from the results study from Roediger & Karpicke et al. (2006)?
A. Educators should test to enhance student memory
B. Test improve learning only with previous study
C. Educators should repeat test multiple time
D. The more early the test the better

title: Summary of Foundation of Assessment
text:
Quiz
Why the test could enhance learning?
A. Test prevents failure to retrieve and improve recall

B. The student study hard to take the test

C. We can help them before they leave us
D. Test help student know what they don’t know

text:

A. OSCE
B. Workplace-based assessment
C. 360 degree evaluation

title: Summary of Foundation of Assessment
text:
Check Reliability

Cronbach’s Alpha
\[
\alpha = \frac{n}{n - 1} \left( 1 - \frac{ \sum \sigma_{x_i}^2 }{ \sigma_x^2 } \right)
\]

n = number of items
\(\sigma_{x_i}\) = variance of the item
\(\sigma_x\) = variance of the test

title: Summary of Foundation of Assessment
text:
Improving Reliability

How many more items to achieve your Spearman-Brown Formula
\[
r_k = \dfrac{k r_1}{1 + (k - 1) r_1}
\]

\(k\) = factor by which test length is changed
\(r_{k}\) = reliability of a test “k” times long
\(r_1\) = reliability of the original test

title: Summary of Foundation of Assessment
text:
Method

Ebel’s Method
360 degree evaluation Artino et al. (2014)

Thinking Block Should we get rid of easy and non-essential?

title: Authentic Assessment - Foundation and application
text:
Authenticity? - WPBA

Does authentic assessment undermine authentic learning?


Yes, only if students perceive it as high-stake exam and judgmental
No, if students could show undercentainty and vulnaribility
No, if the WPA is authentic and acknowledge complexity of case



Hatala and Ellaway (2024)

title: Summary of Foundation of Assessment
text:
Check Reliability
Cronbach’s Alpha
\[
\alpha = \frac{n}{n - 1} \left( 1 - \frac{ \sum \sigma_{x_i}^2 }{ \sigma_x^2 } \right)
\]

n = number of items
\(\sigma_{x_i}\) = variance of the item
\(\sigma_x\) = variance of the test

title: Summary of Foundation of Assessment
text:
Improving Reliability
How many more items you need to achieve your desired reliability - Spearman-Brown Formula
\[
r_k = \dfrac{k r_1}{1 + (k - 1) r_1}
\]

\(k\) = factor by which test length is changed
\(r_{k}\) = reliability of a test “k” times long
\(r_1\) = reliability of the original test

title: Summary of Foundation of Assessment
text:
Check Reliability

Cronbach’s Alpha
\[
\alpha = \frac{n}{n - 1} \left( 1 - \frac{ \sum \sigma_{x_i}^2 }{ \sigma_x^2 } \right)
\]

n = number of items
\(\sigma_{x_i}\) = variance of the item
\(\sigma_x\) = variance of the test

title: Summary of Foundation of Assessment
text:
Improving Reliability

How many more items to achieve your Spearman-Brown Formula
\[
r_k = \dfrac{k r_1}{1 + (k - 1) r_1}
\]

\(k\) = factor by which test length is changed
\(r_{k}\) = reliability of a test “k” times long
\(r_1\) = reliability of the original test

title: Summary of Foundation of Assessment
text:
Method

Ebel’s Method
360 degree evaluation Artino et al. (2014)

Thinking Block Should we get rid of easy and non-essential?

title: Try Journal
text:
It’s our pleasure to announce that our department has recently been awarded the highly-coveted Sixtus Award for Excellence in Chemical Research. This is a massive achievement for our department, and we couldn’t be prouder.

Our Lab has synthesized the most elements of them all.
— Prof. Herzog

The Sixtus Award is a prestigious recognition given to institutions that have demonstrated exceptional performance in chemical research. The award is named after the renowned chemist Sixtus Leung, who made significant contributions to the field of organic chemistry.
This achievement is a testament to the hard work, dedication, and passion of our faculty, students, and staff. Our department has consistently produced groundbreaking research that has contributed to the advancement of the field of chemistry, and we’re honored to receive this recognition.
The award will be presented to our department in a formal ceremony that will take place on May 15th, 2023. We encourage all members of our department to join us in celebrating this achievement.


Elizabeth Lee, a leading researcher in the field of biochemistry, spoke about her recent work on the development of new cancer treatments using small molecule inhibitors, and the lecture was very well-attended by both students and faculty.
In case you missed it, there’s a recording on EDGARP



Next Tuesday, there will be a Lab Safety Training.
These trainings are crucial for ensuring that all members of the department are equipped with the necessary knowledge and skills to work safely in the laboratory. Attendance is mandatory.

title: Authentic Assessment - Foundation and application
text:
Authenticity? - WPBA

Does authentic assessment undermine authentic learning?


Yes, only if students perceive it as high-stake exam and judgmental
No, if students could show undercentainty and vulnaribility
No, if the WPA is authentic and acknowledge complexity of case

title: SHEE Sharing Slides 2024-2025
Alternatives to NHST
text:
Use both NHST and confidence intervals





We also studied the validity by comparing the mean ability ratings of children in different grades. We expected a positive relation between grade and ability. Figure 5 shows the average ability rating for each grade and domain. As expected, children in older age groups had a higher rating than children in younger age groups. In all four domains, there is an overall significant effect of grade: addition \(F(5,1456)=1091.4,p<.01,\omega^2=.78\), subtraction \(F(5,1363)=780.5,p<.01,\omega^2=.74\), multiplication \(F(5,1215)=409.6,p<.01,\omega^2=.62\), and \(F(5,973)=223.31,p<.01,\omega^2=.53\) for division. Levene’s tests show differences in variances for the domains multiplication and division. However, the non-parametric Kruskal-Wallis tests also show significant differences for these domains: \(\chi^2(5)=753.28,p<.01\) for multiplication and \(\chi^2(5)=505.17,p<.01\) for division. For all domains, post hoc analyses show significant differences between all grades, except for the differences between grades five and six [@KLINKENBERG20111813].

title: Alternatives to NHST
text: We also studied the validity by comparing the mean ability ratings of children in different grades. We expected a positive relation between grade and ability. Figure 5 shows the average ability rating for each grade and domain. As expected, children in older age groups had a higher rating than children in younger age groups. In all four domains, there is an overall significant effect of grade: addition \(F(5,1456)=1091.4,p<.01,\omega^2=.78\), subtraction \(F(5,1363)=780.5,p<.01,\omega^2=.74\), multiplication \(F(5,1215)=409.6,p<.01,\omega^2=.62\), and \(F(5,973)=223.31,p<.01,\omega^2=.53\) for division. Levene’s tests show differences in variances for the domains multiplication and division. However, the non-parametric Kruskal-Wallis tests also show significant differences for these domains: \(\chi^2(5)=753.28,p<.01\) for multiplication and \(\chi^2(5)=505.17,p<.01\) for division. For all domains, post hoc analyses show significant differences between all grades, except for the differences between grades five and six [@KLINKENBERG20111813].

title: Prab-Thesis Writing Plan
text:
gantt
    title Timeline-Thesis Writing Plan
    dateFormat  YYYY-MM-DD
    axisFormat  %d-%b
    
    section Background
    Finish Background     :active, bg1, 2025-04-08, 5d
    section Analysis
    Write Analysis      :done     an1, 2025-04-10, 3d
    section Figures/Tables
    Revised-Finalized Figures/Tables (w/ Tari)      :ft1, 2025-04-15, 1d
    section Results
    Write Results         :       rs1, after ft1, 8d
    
    section Discussion
    Write Discussion      :dc1, 2025-04-20, 7d
    section Conclusion
    Write Conclusion      :cc1, 2025-04-27, 3d
    section Abstract
    Write Abstract        :ab1, 2025-04-30, 0.5d

    section Revision
    First Half-revision   :rev1, 2025-04-20, 7d
    Final Revision        :rev2, after ab1, 14d
    Send to committee     :sen1, after rev2, 14d
    
    Final thesis committee - Period  :ftc, 2025-05-27, 20d
    Thesis-Final revision :revf, after ftc, 10d
    Thesis-submission     :sbm2, after revf, 5d
